2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.1: And the sons of the prophets said to Eliseus: Behold the place where we dwell with thee is too strait for us.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.2: Let us go as far as the Jordan and take out of the wood every man a piece of timber, that we may build us there a place to dwell in. And he said: Go.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.3: And one of them said: But come thou also with thy servants. He answered: I will come.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.4: So he went with them. And when they were come to the Jordan they cut down wood.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.5: And it happened, as one was felling some timber, that the head of the axe fell into the water: and he cried out, and said: Alas, alas, alas, my lord, for this same was borrowed.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.6: And the man of God said: Where did it fall? and he shewed him the place. Then he cut off a piece of wood, and cast it in thither: and the iron swam.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.7: And he said: Take it up. And he put out his hand and took it.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.8: And the king of Syria warred against Israel, and took counsel with his servants, saying: In such and such a place let us lay ambushes.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.9: And the man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying: Beware that thou pass not to such a place: for the Syrians are there in ambush.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.10: And the king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God had told him, and prevented him, and looked well to himself there not once nor twice.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.11: And the heart of the king of Syria was troubled for this thing. And calling together his servants, he said: Why do you not tell me who it is that betrays me to the king of Israel?
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.12: And one of his servants said: No one, my lord O king: but Eliseus the prophet, that is in Israel, telleth the king of Israel all the words, that thou speakest in thy privy chamber.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.13: And he said to them: Go, and see where he is: that I may send, and take him. And they told him, saying: Behold he is in Dothan.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.14: Therefore he sent thither horses and chariots, and the strength of an army: and they came by night, and beset the city.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.15: And the servant of the man of God rising early, went out, and saw an army round about the city, and horses and chariots: and he told him, saying: Alas, alas, alas, my lord, what shall we do?
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.16: But he answered: Fear not: for there are more with us than with them.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.17: And Eliseus prayed, and said: Lord, open his eyes, that he may see. And the Lord opened the eyes of the servant, and he saw: and behold the mountain was full of horses, and chariots of fire round about Eliseus.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.18: And the enemies came down to him, but Eliseus prayed to the Lord, saying: Strike, I beseech thee, this people with<u>blindness</u>. And the Lord struck them with blindness, according to the word of Eliseus.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.19: And Eliseus said to them: This is not the way, neither is this the city: follow me, and I will shew you the man whom you seek. So he led them into Samaria.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.20: And when they were come into Samaria, Eliseus said: Lord, open the eyes of these men, that they may see. And the Lord opened their eyes, and they saw themselves to be in the midst of Samaria.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.21: And the king of Israel said to Eliseus, when he saw them: My father, shall I kill them?
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.22: And he said: Thou shalt not kill them: for thou didst not take them with thy sword, or thy bow, that thou mayst kill them: but set bread and water before them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.23: And a great provision of meats was set before them, and they ate and drank, and he let them go, and they went away to their master, and the robbers of Syria came no more into the land of Israel.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.24: And it came to pass after these things, that Benadad king of Syria gathered together all his army, and went up, and besieged Samaria.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.25: And there was a great famine in Samaria: and so long did the siege continue, till the head of an ass was sold for fourscore pieces of silver, and the fourth part of a cabe of pigeon's dung, for five pieces of silver.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.26: And as the king of Israel was passing by the wall, a certain woman cried out to him, saying: Save me, my lord O king.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.27: And he said: If the Lord doth not save thee, how can I save thee? out of the barnfloor, or out of the winepress? And the king said to her: What aileth thee? And she answered:
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.28: This woman said to me: Give thy son, that we may eat him today, and we will eat my son tomorrow.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.29: So we boiled my son, and ate him. And I said to her on the next day: Give thy son that we may eat him. And she hath hid her son.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.30: When the king heard this, he rent his garments, and passed by upon the wall. And all the people saw the haircloth which he wore within next to his flesh.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.31: And the king said: May God do so and so to me, and may he add more, if the head of Eliseus the son of Saphat shall stand on him this day.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.32: But Eliseus sat in his house, and the ancients sat with him. So he sent a man before: and before that messenger came, he said to the ancients: Do you know that this son of a murderer hath sent to cut off my head? Look then, when the messenger shall come, shut the door, and suffer him not to come in: for behold the sound of his master's feet is behind him.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__06.33: While he was yet speaking to them, the messenger appeared who was coming to him. And he said: Behold, so great an evil is from the Lord: what shall I look for more from the Lord?
